meanings.definition: A Cajun dish typically made with shellfish, vegetables, and a roux.
meanings.sent1: The etouffee at the Cajun restaurant was full of shrimp and okra.
meanings.sent2: I ordered a bowl of spicy etouffee for dinner last night.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the etouffee on his apron, creating a saucy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a pot of simmering etouffee.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the savory etouffee filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: To cook something in a sauce made with butter and flour.
meanings.sent1: She decided to etouffee the chicken in a rich sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The chef will etouffee the vegetables before adding them to the stew.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally etouffeed the pasta, turning it into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the simmering sauce etouffeed the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The buttery sauce etouffeed the shrimp to perfection, creating a delicious meal.
